definition: to stand aside and do nothing (idiom)/to take no part in
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
to scatter/to sprinkle/to spill
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards

sentences.english: Customers will worry you're going to flake out and leave them stranded.
sentences.chinese: 客户们担心你的信誉，害怕你会突然撒手不管。

sentences.english: The Indian government also appears to have washed its hands of the plant.
sentences.chinese: 而印度政府对这家工厂的态度似乎也是撒手不管。

definition: to avoid a problem by walking away from it/to quit
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
lit. arm-flinging shopkeeper/fig. sb who asks others to work but does nothing himself
(coll.) to quit one's job in disgust
to take a laissez-faire attitude
not to get involved/to stay out of it
lit. to go beyond the sacrificial altar and take over the kitchen (idiom); fig. to exceed one's place and meddle in other people's affairs/to take matters into one's own hands
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to act arbitrarily regardless of the rules/to mess with sth/to make a hash of things/to cause trouble
to make oneself scarce/to slip away/to take French leave

definition: to emerge and perish on its own; to run its course (idiom)
